name: Biggles and Erich von Stalhein. Quiz  | 15 Questions

questions.text: In which book do Biggles and Erich von Stalhein first meet?
questions.explanation:
Biggles Flies East.

	In fact Erich von Stalhein only appears in one of the Biggles "directions" books. "Biggles Flies East" is set during World War I. Biggles is working undercover and von Stalhein definitely has his suspicions about him. The book ends with a crash in which Erich is apparently killed.

questions.text: In "Biggles & Co." von Stalhein arranges a firing squad.Which one of the comrades does he intend shall be the victim?
questions.explanation:
Ginger.

	Von Stalhein tells Biggles that the firing squad was merely a ruse to get Biggles to give himself up. Ginger as a mere boy would not have been shot, he claims. It is sometimes difficult to know when Erich is telling the truth.

questions.text: What is the first name of Erich von Stalhein's nephew?
questions.explanation:
Fritz.

	The nephew's full name is Fritz Lowenhardt. He comes to see Biggles in London after his uncle has been put into the political prison on the island of Sakhalin. Fritz wants Biggles to consider attempting a rescue of Erich.

questions.text: How does Zorotov die in "No Rest for Biggles"?
questions.correct: Von Stalhein shoots him dead with a pistol
options: Von Stalhein pushes him in the way of a stampeding buffalo
Von Stalhein pushes him out of the side of an aeroplane
Von Stalhein leaves him to die of thirst in the desert
questions.explanation:
Von Stalhein shoots him dead with a pistol.

	Zorotov is supposed to be on the same side as von Stalhein. However, Erich doesn't hesitate to gun him down when he thinks his plan to obtain the aeroplane with the special device is about to be frustrated. Later in the same book von Stalhein orders the massacre of a large number of Africans for much the same reason.

questions.text: In which "Biggles" story does von Stalhein give Biggles information about a man called Hugo Schultz?
questions.explanation:
Biggles in Mexico.

	The interview with von Stalehin comes at the beginning of "Biggles in Mexico". This is after "Biggles Buries a Hatchet" where Erich was rescued from Sakhalin by Biggles and his team. After the way he has been treated by his former employers von Stalhein is reluctantly prepared to give information about them.

questions.text: In which country do Biggles and Erich von Stalhein meet up in "Biggles Sees it Through"?
questions.explanation:
Finland.

	The meeting takes place during the Russo-Finnish war. However, von Stalhein is in Finland to obtain the documents that an escaping scientist has carried to the depths of the frozen countryside.

questions.text: At which musical instrument does Erich von Stalhein prove to be proficient?
questions.explanation:
The violin.

	It is in "Biggles Looks Back" that this information is revealed. Indeed Erich incorporates this skill into his disguise as he earns a living by working as a musician whilst searching for news of Marie Janis, the woman that he once loved.

questions.text: Which one of the comrades makes a bet with Erich von Stalhein in "Biggles Takes Charge"?
questions.explanation:
Algy.

	The wager is for five thousand francs and Algy wins the money when he and von Stalhein phone Biggles who confirms that Algy was telling the truth. This is the story where later on there is a good deal of excitement in a car chase where sugar beet on the road becomes a vital factor.

questions.text: What distinctive item of clothing does Erich von Stalhein wear in "Biggles Follows On"?
questions.explanation:
A tie.

	The tie is one of the symbols of the organisation that is recruiting soldiers from the West to go and join a new army elsewhere. Biggles is clever enough to realise that it may help him and his assistants if they too wear the same sort of tie.

questions.text: What is the name of the Russian whom Erich von Stalhein plies with drink in "Biggles Gets His Men"?
questions.explanation:
Petroffsky.

	When Bertie points out von Stalhein has only been offering Petroffsky the vodka bottle in order to get him drunk enough to talk, the Russian says, "Could a man be so base?" Bertie replies, "Von Stalhein's methods are so low that no one yet has got to the bottom of them."

questions.text: In which World War 2 "Biggles" story does von Stalhein visit Norway?
questions.explanation:
Biggles Defies the Swastika.

	At one point Erich nearly has all three comrades imprisoned together at once. However, Biggles devises a clever means of escape and he and Algy are free by the time Ginger is brought along to join them.

questions.text: In which "Biggles" adventure does Air Commodore Raymond produce a photograph of Erich von Stalhein as one of a group of seven men dressed in tropical kit?
questions.explanation:
Biggles in Australia.

	It seems strange that the normally immaculate Erich should turn up looking "dirty, shrunken and generally disreputable". Von Stalhein claims that he had been studying oceanography but his purpose in Australia is really to stir up trouble amongst the Aborigines.

questions.text: How does Biggles get the better of both Liebgarten and von Stalhein as he sits in the lounge of the house in "Happy Valley"?
questions.correct: He disconnected the electric flex with his foot and plunged the room into darkness
options: He sent the drinks trolley suddenly crashing down to the floor so that he had time to draw his automatic
He tilted the mirror suddenly so that both men were unexpectedly blinded
He overturned the table with a flick of his wrist so that both men were knocked to the floor
questions.explanation:
He disconnected the electric flex with his foot and plunged the room into darkness.

	Once again in "Biggles Takes a Holiday" we learn about Eric von Stalhein's career as a member of the Gestapo. Stitzen, with whom von Stalhein has now chosen to live, is one of the Nazis who spent their time conducting brutal medical experiments using human guinea-pigs.

questions.text: In "Biggles in the Blue" what is the name of the yacht stolen by von Stalhein and his associates?
questions.explanation:
Vega.

	This is also the story where Erich manages to appear to be in two places at once. By the side of the swimming pool he plants a double complete with a monocle and a long cigarette holder and meanwhile he sets out on his mission at Rumkeg Haven. However, it is his failure in this story (amongst others) that makes the Communists believe that he is really collaborating with Biggles.

questions.text: What is von Stalhein's official position in "Biggles Secret Agent"?
questions.correct: The Lucranian Chief of Secret Police
options: The Head of Gestapo at the Kiel Canal
The Senior German Commander of West Bavaria
The Chief of the German Stormtroopers in East Prussia
questions.explanation:
The Lucranian Chief of Secret Police.

	As "Biggles Secret Agent" is set just before World War 2 W.E.Johns is careful to choose a Ruritanian title for the country where the events take place. However, Lucrania is obviously modelled on a Nazi German puppet state like Lichtenstein or Austria after the annexation. There are certainly persecuted Jews and brutal stormtroopers and von Stalhein, in spite of his outward courtesy, behaves with all his usual devious nastiness.
